data.quote: I would teach peace rather than war. I would inculcate love rather than hate.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: The great moral teachers of humanity were, in a way, artistic geniuses in the art of living.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: The present is theirs; the future, for which I really worked, is mine.
data.author: Nikola Tesla

data.quote: I do not think you can name many great inventions that have been made by married men.
data.author: Nikola Tesla

data.quote: It is hard to fail, but it is worse never to have tried to succeed.
data.author: Theodore Roosevelt

data.quote: Speak softly and carry a big stick; you will go far.
data.author: Theodore Roosevelt

data.quote: In the face of impossible odds, people who love this country can change it.
data.author: Barack Obama

data.quote: Focusing your life solely on making a buck shows a poverty of ambition. It asks too little of yourself. And it will leave you unfulfilled.
data.author: Barack Obama
